definition: to take unfair advantage of/to deceive/to cheat
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)

sentences.english: He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华不容什么人欺负他们，为他们的缘故责备君王。

sentences.english: The fresh boy is always bullied by seniors at school.
sentences.chinese: 那个新来的男孩在学校里总是被学长欺负。

sentences.english: That's how schoolyard bullies run playgrounds and global godfathers do it everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 这就是校园欺负运行操场和全球教父做到无处不在。

sentences.english: He often bullies you. I really take up the cudgel for you.
sentences.chinese: 他常欺负你，我真为你打抱不平。

sentences.english: This is a vast nation like China would let the Sri Lankan bully?
sentences.chinese: 中国这泱泱大国还会让这斯欺负？

sentences.english: "Who dare bully my son?! "Father leads Son by the hand out ot the house.
sentences.chinese: “谁敢欺负我的乖儿子？”爸爸牵着儿子就往外走。

sentences.english: Sometimes I thought she just bullied me.
sentences.chinese: 有时我认为她就是在欺负我。

sentences.english: At first, Chan seems to be a pathetic patsy to Tuckers aggression.
sentences.chinese: 起初，成龙像是个老受塔克欺负的倒霉蛋。

sentences.english: Iraq shares a table, before is always bullied by Iraq, has class leader to support luckily.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉克同桌，以前老被伊拉克欺负，幸好有班长撑腰。

sentences.english: She's a doormat in the company, even the green hand can wrong her.
sentences.chinese: 她在公司就是个受气包，甚至新手也可以欺负她。

sentences.english: Animals who are dressed-up. An analogy meaning immoral and despicable people.
sentences.chinese: 你这个衣冠禽兽就知道欺负女人。

sentences.english: O. K. didn't humiliate this, otherwise, I will likewise dead to have no whole corpseses.
sentences.chinese: 还好没有欺负到这小子头上，不然，我也会死无全尸。

sentences.english: IT employ to bully me in high educate.
sentences.chinese: 高等初等中等学校时她常常欺负我。

sentences.english: The result is not good, the family circumstances are poor, receives the human to bully frequently.
sentences.chinese: 成绩不好，家境贫寒，经常受人欺负。

sentences.english: But others lack confidence because of the high school bully factor.
sentences.chinese: 还有些人因为高中有受到过欺负的经历而信心不足。

sentences.english: What you know about bein bullied over half your life?
sentences.chinese: 你知道半辈子都被人欺负的滋味吗？

definition: to be beaten/to take a drubbing/buffeted/knocked about
to take a beating/to get thrashed/to come under attack
to look down upon/to hold in contempt
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
to beat up/to break to pieces
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
see 恃強欺弱|恃强欺弱[shi4 qiang2 qi1 ruo4]
to take liberties with a woman/to dally/to assail a woman with obscenities
